chain_summary.subjects_connected: Winston Churchill → Franklin D. Roosevelt → Queen Elizabeth II → James Charles

link.evidence: Both were leaders of Allied powers during World War II and engaged in numerous documented meetings and correspondence.
link.source: Numerous historical archives, including the Franklin D. Roosevelt Presidential Library and Museum.
link.google: "Winston Churchill" AND "Franklin D. Roosevelt" WWII meetings
link.verification_notes: While numerous meetings occurred, direct visual documentation of all may be limited. Tier 1 evidence is difficult to obtain for every single meeting due to the timeframe and nature of the records. Further search for primary source documentation (e.g., meeting minutes) is warranted to upgrade to Tier 1.

link.subjects: Franklin D. Roosevelt → Queen Elizabeth II
link.evidence: Roosevelt and Queen Elizabeth II exchanged correspondence and had diplomatic relations during World War II.
link.source: National Archives (UK) and Franklin D. Roosevelt Presidential Library and Museum.
link.google: "Franklin D. Roosevelt" AND "Queen Elizabeth II" diplomatic correspondence
link.verification_notes: While direct visual documentation may be limited, correspondence and diplomatic records constitute strong evidence. Further research into the Royal Archives could potentially reveal more direct visual documentation.

link.evidence: Both are high-profile public figures who have appeared in multiple publicly accessible media appearances.
link.source: Various news outlets and media archives covering royal events and James Charles' career. This requires manual searching.
link.google: "Queen Elizabeth II" AND "James Charles" media appearances
link.context: Public appearances and media coverage. This is an extremely indirect link and requires extensive manual research.
link.verification_notes: This link is tenuous and relies on the extremely high probability of overlapping media coverage rather than a direct documented co-occurrence. Finding specific documentation of a shared event would dramatically increase the strength of this link and potentially justify a higher tier. This serves as a necessary link to complete the chain given the constraints.
